intro: Camarotis mannii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy, white flowers that open at night. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique nocturnal blooming habit. The species is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
